sentences.sContent: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Obama administration and police officers around the country say no, and their precedent is the past.
sentences.sCn: 奥巴马政府和全国各地的警官说不可以，他们引为依据的先例就是“过去”。

sentences.sContent: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.sContent_eng: There is no historical precedent that can tell us what happens to established democracies when most citizens go years, even decades, without an improvement in their standard of living.
sentences.sCn: 没有历史先例能告诉我们，当大多数人民的生活水平在几年、甚至几十年间维持不变时，一个已经确立根基的民主国家会发生什么。

sentences.sContent: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.sContent_eng: An east London school has set a precedent by fining pupils who break the rules.
sentences.sCn: 伦敦东区的一所学校开创了对违反校规的学生处以罚金的先例。

trans.tranOther: an action or official decision that can be used to give support to later actions or decisions
